parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The provided data does not contain any information suggesting the presence of a CMF number in the Facebook post.  The absence of a CMF number does not automatically exclude the possibility of electoral propaganda, but it is a factor to consider.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The image's text is in Hungarian, and urges Hungarians in Romania to vote. While it doesn't name specific candidates, it strongly implies a call to action for a particular group likely aligned with a specific political party representing Hungarian interests in Romania (RMDSZ, based on the advertiser information). This indirectly refers to candidates from that party.  This could be considered as fulfilling "Article 36 (7) - a" indirectly.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform. The targeting data shows a wide geographical reach across multiple counties in Romania, indicating an attempt to reach a large audience. This satisfies "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The primary objective of the post is to encourage a specific segment of the population (Hungarians in Romania) to vote.  The phrasing "December 1-jén a magyarok nem veszíthetnek" ("On December 1st, Hungarians cannot lose") strongly suggests an intention to influence the outcome of the election by increasing voter turnout for a particular group. This clearly fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present itself as journalistic. It lacks objectivity and instead promotes a specific political agenda, urging a particular group to vote. It does not provide balanced information or analysis.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The post does not express a personal opinion; it's a clear call to action with an electoral objective.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>583730777346361</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while not explicitly mentioning specific candidates, strongly encourages a particular ethnic group to vote, implying support for candidates representing their interests. The targeting data shows a broad reach, and the message's urgency and implicit endorsement of a particular political outcome clearly aim to influence the election.  The post's content and targeting strongly suggest it's a form of electoral propaganda, even without explicitly naming candidates. The timing of the post (after the official campaign period) is also a crucial factor.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate>
    <name>RMDSZ Candidates</name>
    <impact>POSITIVE</impact>
  </candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>RMDSZ</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
RMDSZ, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări pe Facebook (ID: 583730777346361) după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care, deși nu menționează candidați specifici, îndeamnă în mod direct populația maghiară din România să voteze, sugerând implicit sprijin pentru candidații RMDSZ. Fraza „December 1-jén a magyarok nem veszíthetnek” are un efect electoral clar, vizând creșterea prezenței la vot în rândul unui anumit grup etnic, influențând astfel rezultatul alegerilor.  Ținând cont de datele de target, care indică o acoperire geografică extinsă, și de mesajul urgent și implicit de susținere a unui anumit rezultat electoral, postarea constituie propagandă electorală, încălcând prevederile legale.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
